name: Techcode Workshop Series – WeChat, Language & Doing Business in China
description:
Dear Techcode Family & Friends,

Our Techcode Meetup Series is going in the next round. On coming Wednesday, Doing Business in China will be our topic. Specifically, we will take a closer look at the modern Chinese consumer. How has consumer behavior changed in the digital age? What has one to keep in mind when entering China? What are efficient methods to study and understand the Chinese market?


Our Techcode Startup Member Anacode will give interesting insights into their work. Anacode developed an innovative market intelligence tool that studies the Chinese market on the basis of Web data and smart data analytics.

There will be an input and Q&A, but also the opportunity for you to share your experiences and perspectives.

We are looking forward to seeing you at TechCode Berlin.

Your TechCode Team

******************************************************** 

Overview of our upcoming meetups:

* Wednesday 16.08. – Digital China Series

China has entered the digital age with great force. China is at the forefront of many digital trends and has produced a number of enormously innovative players such as Alibaba, Tencent or Baidu. Let’s find out more about Digital China and the people taking part.

* Wednesday 23.08. – Chinese Language and Culture
You always wanted to know how the Chinese language works? Is it really so difficult to learn? What about the four tones and how to write characters?

* Wednesday 30.08. – Business Culture in China 
Are there actual do’s and don’ts when interacting with Chinese partners? Is there a concrete toolset for making business in China? Do I have to speak Chinese to be successful in China? Or do I just have to be open, curious and empathetic? Come around and let’s discuss if there is something as a distinct Chinese business culture.

* Wednesday 06.09. – Doing business in China 
Have you ever asked yourself why the Chinese market is so interesting to foreign companies? What are the reasons for setting up business in China? Let’s have a look at different motivations for doing business in China.

****************************************************** 

For all of our workshops, we would be excited if someone wants to give a short input and share some China experiences. If you would like to do so, we are looking forward to receiving a short message ([masked]). 


We are looking forward to seeing you at TechCode Berlin.

Your TechCode Germany Team

name: Beach Volleyball (for Beginners) in Beach Mitte (Berlin Mitte)
description:
***Please Find English Version Below*** 

Hi Leute, wir haben für die Saison 2017 ein Feld für jeden Mittwoch von 18-20Uhr für eine Anfängergruppe (freies Spiel) gebucht. Es wird die gesamte Saison immer auf dem Feld 19 (Siehe Bild) gespielt. Dort ist auch der Treffpunkt. In seltenen Fällen nimmt sich Beach Mitte das Recht vor den Platz zu wechseln. Daher fragt bitte am Counter nach, falls das Feld belegt oder anwerweitig verwendet wird. Ihr benötigt für diese Gruppe keinerlei Grundlagen oder spezielle Techniken. Das wichtigste ist der Spaß und die gute Laune.

=> Platzbuchung ab sofort bitte immer hier direkt über Meetup. Mit der Online Zahlung gehen wir sicher, dass jeder kommt und am Ende keiner mehr zahlen muss. Bis zu 24 Stunden vor Spielbeginn könnt ihr natürlich kostenfrei stornieren.

Falls du noch Fragen hast, melde dich einfach. Ich wünsche euch ganz viel Spaß und ein paar sonnige Spiele, Tim

__________________________

Hi guys, 

for season 2017 we booked one field for every Wednesday from 6 pm to 8 pm for a beginner (free game). The first date is 19 April. The entire season, we will always play on the field 19 (see picture). This is also the meeting point. In rare cases, Beach Mitte takes the right to change places. For this reason, please ask at the counter if the field is used or used for other purposes. 

You don’t need any basic or special techniques for this group. Just come around and have fun. 

=> Please book your place from now on here on Meetup. With the online payment, we make sure that everyone comes and no one has to pay more at the end. Up to 24 hours before the start of the game you can cancel for free.

Please let me know if you have any questions. I wish you a lot of fun and sunny games, Tim

name: Want to teach at ReDI School? // Info event

venue.name: ReDi School of Digital Integration Headquarter

group.name: ReDI School of Digital Integration - Berlin

description:
The ReDI School Autumn Semester (Sept 16-Dec 15th) is around the corner, and we are looking for more teachers to support our growing student community, by teaching 3-months intro courses to programming. 

If you are interested to learn more, please join us on Wednesday at ReDI School to learn more about the teaching opportunities. 

ABOUT US

ReDI School of Digital Integration is a non-profit digital school for tech-interested newcomers applying for asylum in Germany.

We offer our students high-quality training and the chance to collaborate with the start-up and digital industry.

Our aim is to provide our students with valuable digital skills and a strong network of tech leaders, students and alumni to help create new opportunities for all.

ABOUT YOU


- You are a socially-committed IT professional


- Looking for a challenge and an opportunity to grow

- Wanting to make a difference for Newcomers together with a committed community

You are able to teach 1-2 times per week, for 2-3 hours per class, usually in the evening [masked]). All classes takes place in central Berlin (Mitte) and you will teach in a team together with 2-4 other IT-professionals. The class size is approx. 10 students who are mostly fluent in English and/or German.

WHAT CAN YOU TEACH?

We are looking for teachers and mentors in the following areas:


- HTML and CSS

- JavaScript

- React

- Java

- Python

- Android app development

- Quality Assurance (QA)

- Arduino and robotics

- Project management and scrum

- Online marketing 

- Basic IT training (for women)

- Basic web shop creation (for women)

- Digital media and photojournalism

- Internet of Things

- App Design (UX and/or UI)

name: Outdoor Fitness (Cardio & Strength) - Advanced Level
description:
*** Eine Deutsche Version findest du unten*** 

Please book all sessions in advance on MEET2MOVE.DE (German & English available).

Our interval training is designed to improve strength, build lean muscles, improves cardiovascular fitness, increase speed and maximize calorie burn. This workout uses a variety of body weight exercises and provides the challenge and intensity you need to get results fast.

At Meet2Move we believe that fitness can be joyful. Soak up some sun while getting sweaty. Forty-five minutes is all it takes to transform the way you look and feel. We run, we jump, we do push-ups, we do burpees, we set our intention, and we break through boundaries. The best part: We do it together, as a community.

Backed by the science of Excess Post-Exercise Oxygen Consumption, Meet2Move's heart rate monitored workout is designed to maintain an optimal target zone that stimulates metabolism and increases energy. The so-called “afterburn effect” enables you to burn an estimated 400 to 750 calories in 45 minutes. And keep burning calories for up to 36 hours.

With powerful music, you’ll get the energy of a group workout with the attention of an inspirational personal coach. Our coaches are knowledgeable, encouraging and are committed to motivating you to go harder to get fit, fast.

In the training for Level 3-5, we will focus on more complex and challenging exercises. Also, the interval cycles will be longer or the pause times will be shorter. Nevertheless, each exercise is explained in different intensities, so that you simply choose your intensity according to your fitness level. Even if you have, for example, knee pain, but otherwise belong to the fitter athletes, we always find a solution. Just talk to me before the training or write me an email to [masked].

You don’t have to bring anything except for your own drink and the heart rate sensor. If it is your first session with us, we will provide you with a sensor. To properly calibrate the system, please send your date of birth, height, and weight to [masked] before the session. I will bring all other equipment and of course some motivational music. Please remember that we train outside in the park and there are no changing rooms on the premises. Within a radius of 100 meters, there are several restaurants that have not been complaining so far, when one of us had to go to the toilet. Since we don’t leave the training place, we have so far not had any problems with theft of our own valuables. 

Only in extremely bad weather conditions will we cancel the workouts. If you would like to be informed in our WhatsApp group, just send me your number and I will add you. For any further questions, please just write me an email to [masked].

I look forward to seeing you, Tim


First Trial Week - FREE OF CHARGE

4 times a month - 12€ (3€/session)

8 times a month - 20€ (2,50€/session)

Unlimited - 30€ (2€/session)

__________________________________________ 

Bitte buche deine Termine immer vorab auf MEET2MOVE.DE.

Unser Intervalltraining ist darauf ausgelegt, deine Kraft zu verbessern, Muskeln aufzubauen, die kardiovaskuläre Fitness zu verbessern, die Schnelligkeit zu erhöhen und deine Kalorienverbrennung zu maximieren. Wir verwenden eine Vielzahl von Körpergewicht Übungen, die Sie benötigen, um schnelle Ergebnisse zu erzielen. 

Wir bei Meet2Move glauben fest daran, dass Fitness jede Menge Spaß macht. 45 Minuten ist alles was du brauchst um dich mit frischer Luft und tollen Trainingspartnern super zu fühlen. Ob Laufen, Liegestütz oder Burpees, wir setzen unser Vorhaben und brechen Grenzen. Der beste Teil: Wir machen es zusammen, als Community.

Wissenschaftlich auf dem Prinzip des Sauerstoffverbrauchs basierend, arbeiten wir bei jedem Training mit deiner Herzfrequenz. Du wirst dabei in deinem optimalen Herzfrequenzbereich trainieren, welcher deinen Stoffwechsel bestmöglich stimuliert und deine Energie erhöht. Der so genannte "Afterburn-Effekt" ermöglicht es dir, in 45 Minuten und den folgenden 36 Stunden bis zu 750 Kalorien zu verbrennen.

Mit motivierender Musik bekommst du die Energie eines Gruppen-Workouts mit der Aufmerksamkeit eines inspirierenden Personal Trainers. Unsere Trainer gehören zu den besten Deutschlands und ermutigen dich in jeder Übung an deine Grenzen zu gehen.

Im Training für Level 3-5 konzentrieren wir uns im Vergleich zu Level 1-3 auf komplexere und anspruchsvollere Übungen, die dich mehr fordern werden. Ebenfalls werden die Intervallzyklen länger sein oder die Pausenzeiten kürzer. Dennoch wird jede Übung in unterschiedlichen Intensitätsstufen erklärt, so dass du dir einfach passend zu deinem Fitnessstand deine Intensität wählst. Auch wenn du beispielsweise Knieschmerzen hast, sonst aber eher zu den Fitteren gehörst, finden wir dafür immer eine Lösung. Wichtig ist, dass du mich dazu einfach vor dem Training darauf ansprichst. Falls Du dennoch unsicher bist, schreib mir einfach ein email an [masked].

Bis auf etwas zu trinken und unserem Pulssensor brauchst du nichts weiter mitzubringen. Wenn es deine erste Einheit ist werden wir dir einen Pulssensor vor Ort zur Verfügung stellen. Um das System richtig zu kalibrieren sende uns bitte vorab dein Geburtsdatum, Größe und Gewicht an [masked]. Ich bringe alle anderen Geräte und natürlich auch motivierende Musik mit. Bitte denkt daran, dass wir draußen im Park trainieren und es vor Ort keine Umkleideräume gibt. Im Umkreis von 100 Metern gibt es mehrere Restaurants, die sich bislang noch nicht beschwert haben, wenn mal einer von uns auf die Toilette musste. Da wir den Trainingsort nicht verlassen, haben wir bislang noch keine Probleme mit Diebstahl von eigenen Wertgegenständen gehabt. 

Nur bei extrem schlechten Wetterbedingungen werden wir die Workouts absagen. Falls du zusätzlich noch in unserer WhatsApp Gruppe informiert werden möchtest sende mir einfach deine Nummer und ich füge dich hinzu. Falls du noch Fragen haben solltest, schreibe mir einfach eine Email an [masked]. 

Ich freue mich auf dich! Tim

description:

Hi product peeps,


we're happy to announce our On Product Summer edition on August 9th at Town Hall (no, not the red big one at Alexanderplatz :) ). This great venue plus food and drinks are generously sponsored by Applause. Town hall is quite huge, so this will probably be the biggest On Product we've hosted yet.

We have a powerful set of speakers confirmed and are super excited to see you in August! :)

Catering
There will be free drinks + several pizza options (meat, veggie, vegan)


Location
Schiffsbauerdamm 22, the building is labeled with "NewStore"

Agenda


19:00 – Open doors + food
19:30 – Introduction On Product, Applause
19:45 – First talk: Presley Prescott - "Cyber Security Threats"
20:15 – Second talk: Jenny Herald - "Wunderlist to Microsoft—Perspective on Wunderlist’s acquisition experience" 
20:45 – Open networking

Presley Prescott - "Cyber Security Threats"

CISO at Twelve Beaufort


Technology executive with over 30 years of experience in IT and Cyber Security. Successfully managed major multiple Global Organization’s Cyber Security Originations and infrastructures. With management and hands on environments. Interface effectively with users at all levels of expertise from legal, finance, investment banking, commercial lending, credit, energy, Telecom and more.

Building corporate value through technology and information systems strategy, selection, implementation, maintenance, and policies, including developing a comprehensive written  proposal on IT services and solutions, is my expertise. Mixed managerial, analytical and  technical skills, and knowledge in all aspects of computer security in multiple IT areas.  Design and build out of Cyber Defense Centers and organization and Cyber Security Infrastructures, for 20 major companies in Europe and 55 in the USA.

Jenny Herald - "Wunderlist to Microsoft—Perspective on Wunderlist’s acquisition experience"

Lead PM for Microsoft To-Do (formerly Wunderlist)


Planning on how to exit is something many of us discuss and can learn about. However, post-acquisition planning is something that is rarely discussed or documented. For example, what happens to a product, the tech or the team post-acquisition? What can one expect or should prepare for post-acquisition? We’ll discuss what Wunderlist experienced after it joined forces with Microsoft which may shed some light on life after an acquisition.

name: Clojure Berlin
description:
Hello everyone, 


This month we'll meet at ThoughtWorks Werkstatt in Mülhauserstr. 6. The meetup takes place in the rear building, 2nd story (go up one flight of stairs).

Here's the plan:

• Introducing Change (from Ruby to Clojure) - Jean-Louis Giordano


This is a user report on how Clojure(Script) was adopted at Zimpler, the challenges we faced and what lies ahead. Most of us have a good intuition on why we like Clojure, some of us have some very rational arguments as to why we prefer Clojure, but why does it seem so hard to convince people around us? Jean-Louis will offer some personal anecdotes and patterns grounded in psychology that he applied when trying to introduce Functional Programming and Clojure to people around him.


Jean-Louis is CTO at Zimpler, and is on a life-long quest to find the essence of programming. Clojure lover, Idris neophyte and unreasonably productive in Ruby.


• Basic event sourcing without all the buzz and fuzz - Oskar Thorén

Event sourcing is a tool that gives us access to the entire history of some piece of data and enables lots of useful things. It is also a buzz word. In this talk I'll show that you don't need Kafka, opaque containers, external providers, and/or a fancy distributed, fault-tolerant cluster setup to do it. You can do it in a few lines of code using only the filesystem.


Oskar bootstraps software products and does Clojure consulting. Previously he worked at uSwitch and went to Recurse Center.

• Vimsical — Dennis Heihoff

I thought it's silly that we only reap the results of our work. Instead I wondered: what if we could see our creations evolve? So I came up with Vimsical which is an integrated, highly granular version control system (called Process Control) that commits changes automatically, and a Player/Recorder API to explore and interact (branch) at any point the process. Vimsical's goal is to add an element of evolution to digital media to nurture understanding and accelerate learning.

Dennis is a filmmaker, Clojure NYC organizer and founder of Vimsical.


---

Clojure Berlin adheres to the Berlin Code of Conduct.

Hope to see you all soon!

Your organizers,

Paulus ([masked]) and Ben ([masked])

name: Rust Hack and Learn

venue.name: Mozilla Berlin Community Space
venue.address_1: Schlesische Straße 27 (GSG-Hof Schlesische Straße Gebäude 3, 4th floor)

description:
Please RSVP on the OpenTechSchool Meetup page: http://www.meetup.com/opentechschool-berlin/events/229885700/


Rust is a new systems programming language developed by Mozilla.

Let's meet for open hacking and (co)-learning in our bi-weekly learning group!

Everyone is welcome. Rusties of all skill levels meet and hack on cool Rust stuff. Please bring a computer (if available) or tell us if you need one, we can provide you with a machine.

Never written a single line of Rust, but interested in the language? Don't worry, most of us are just starting off. There are people around to get you set up and going.

Already have a project? Just hack on it or find others interested in contributing. If you have something working, you can put it on the big screen and show everyone.

Don't have a project yet? There are lots of ideas and cool projects floating around that you can work on!

name: Digital Nomad Show #1 (30 Tage Wert geben Challenge)
description:
Schau Dir jetzt mein Einladungsvideo an: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T5b4YjrNlFg 

Hier direkt anmelden (keine Email Adresse nötig): http://freedomacademy.de/Show

Bratislava: Ich sitze am Fluss und höre dem rauschen der Wellen zu! Ja es ist schön hier! Aber noch nicht schön genug, um nicht mal einen Blick in unsere Digitale Nomaden Community zu werfen. Schnell ist das Handy aus der Tasche gezogen und die Seite Meetup.com angesteuert...

MIST...

Ich bin mal wieder nicht in Deutschland zum nächsten "Digitalen Nomaden Meetup". Und es sind schon einige Nomads angemeldet. Oh, man wie gerne würde ich da vorbeischauen... 

Also was machen?

Klar. Die Lösung ist ganz einfach. Wir sind doch alle digitale Nomaden und im Gegensatz zur restlichen Bevölkerung können wir einen Computer bedienen ;-).

Warum also nicht mal zwischendurch ein Meetup Online veranstalten. Wir treffen uns quasi online und quatschen ein bisschen! Bringen unsere Projekte weiter und nachher klappen wir den Laptop zu und gehen zum Strand, oder in die Disko! 

So haben wir eins der größten Digitalen Nomaden Probleme gelöst! Das Problem, dass man seine Bekanntschaften daheim so schlecht pflegen kann während man auf Reisen ist.

Beim ersten Meetup werden wir darüber sprechen, wie Du Deine Fähigkeit steigern kannst anderen Menschen zu helfen und dadurch eine der wichtigsten Eigenschaften von Unternehmern verinnerlichst. Wir starten zusammen eine 30 Tage Wert geben Challenge! Dadurch wirst Du Dir in sehr kurzer Zeit ein starkes Netzwerk aufbauen, welches Du brauchst um Dein Online Projekt erfolgreich zu machen.

Also los gehts! Melde Dich jetzt an (keine Email Adresse nötig):  http://freedomacademy.de/Show

Meld Dich auf jeden Fall auch an, wenn Du beim ersten Online Meetup nicht dabei sein kannst. Wir informieren Dich dann über die weiteren Termine.

name: A meditative dining experience from Japan - part 1 (FULLY BOOKED!)
Illustrators Book Club!
description:
Illustrators’ Book Club! 


Every Wednesday, 9th August - 30th August[masked]pm, 

A 4 week introduction to Fictional Book illustration. 

Taking a book from the given list of classic titles you will develop a series of 3 finished illustrations in a medium of your choice. This intensive course will look at how to interpret a text, generate a vision, create a sense of narrative, use colour, texture, composition and perspective. The aim is to make a series of illustrations that make sense to the story but also offer the viewpoint of the illustrator. 


This course is best suited to those with a basic level of drawing or with an existing interest in illustration. It will be a great opportunity for creatively minded individuals to refresh their skills, generate new work and meet like-minded individuals. 

Work will be completed through a series discussions and workshop exercises designed to help you take your ideas from rough to finals.

Please bring your materials of choice. Some paper and workshop materials will be provided.

 Price: €75

Book List:

Metamorphosis by Franz Kafka

Alice in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll

On the Road by Jack Kerouac

Brave New World by Aldous Huxley

Wuthering Heights by Emily Bronte

Invisible Cities by Italo Calvino

To the Lighthouse by Virginia Woolf

Peter Pan by J. M Barrie

Detailed Course Outline:

It is recommended that you read your text before the class starts so we can have the full four weeks to develop your illustrations with plenty of time for advice, testing and feedback. 

Week One - Introductions

An introduction to book illustration throughout history, including some valuable references, inspiration and ideas on what works and what to avoid. 

Round table discussion about selected texts. 

Drawing warm up to get ideas onto paper, help to choose appropriate moments within the story and work out problems. 

Week Two - Setting the tone and style. 

Some short exercises to help you to think about your own particular style of illustration and the ways in which you can explore this. 

Critique with whole class on initial rough ideas to be developed as homework. 

Week three - Colour and Tone

Working on the final designs we will start to really pick apart your ideas, introducing the ways in which you might use colour, texture and composition to improve your images. 

Week Four - Final presentation

Finishing off your final illustrations you will present to the rest of the class.

name: Community and Open Networking Night @ Baumhaus + Jam Session

venue.name: Das Baumhaus Berlin
venue.address_1: Gerichtstr. 23, 13347 Berlin, front house, ground floor

group.name: Berlin Collaborative Creative Projects For A Better World

description:
Come early to enjoy our informal networking open house and the rescued bio food buffet hosted by The Real Junk Food Project: Berlin and then stay for the I.G.O. meditative jam session...

We are looking forward to meeting with different groups and individuals to see what collaborations we can develop and inspire while enjoying a good meal together.

Improvisational Groove Orchestra (I.G.O.) – a fun way to experience authentic connection and community through exploring a commonly created sound space. (description & links to examples below)


Program:

16:00 - Volunteer to help cook

17:00 - Doors Open - Chill and open networking in the "Open Greeting Zone" :: pay as you feel, 2 - 5€ at the door

20:15 - Annoucements, News, Quick Pitches (1 min) & a short provocation. Tonight's theme :: RESONANCE

20:30 - rescued bio food buffet (pay as you feel) + emergent networking and hangout

21:30 - I.G.O. Vocal Jam Session - start warming up and jamming! (in the back room)


IGO - Improvisational Groove Orchestra

We meet every other EVERY Thursday for a short intro session to listen, respond, observe and curiously play with the sounds our voices create together. Our objective is to tune into the common feeling we are developing in the present moment.

Most of what we do is with our eyes closed. This allows everyone to be very focused on only the sound space without any other distractions.

At each session we usually have more beginners rather than experienced singers; all levels and voice types are welcome. Scott will explain a few basic and intuitively understandable concepts to make it super easy to dive in and be jamming out within the first 15 minutes! It is a learning process in progress, each time balancing ourselves in volume and expression to merge into the group sound space, allowing everyone to hear and be heard, naturally developing our own musical styles.

The last times we explored further into the human sequencer game – a system where one person acts as a conductor, splitting the group into small parts, giving each small group unique impulses that than develop into one composition.

Feel most welcome to come and join us! (please be on time, there are important things to explain before beginning)


** Pay as you feel, 2 - 5€ after the session

• You can find older tracks from previous IGO session in Das Baumhaus here: - https://soundcloud.com/scott-bolden/ebb-and-flow-p2-edit-2- https://soundcloud.com/scott-bolden/sets/ego-session-5-nov-13-2014 (Track 3)

• Here is a video showing another fun method with larger groups: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bjzmfpnZhDk

The address is Gerichtstr. 23 in the front house on the ground floor, you can walk in our door from the sidewalk. We will have some all kinds of drinks available at the bar.

name: Introduction to Bayesian modeling with PyMC3
description:
Juan Orduz will speak about PyMC3 and Bayesian modeling. The aim of this talk is to give an introduction to PyMC3, a Python package for Bayesian statistical modeling and Probabilistic Machine Learning. In the Bayesian framework quantities of interest, such as parameters of a statistical model, are treated as random variables. One draws conclusions of these quantities by analyzing the posterior distribution obtained from observed data. In practice, the resulting posterior distribution does not always have a known parametrization and therefore sampling methods become very handy.

The outline of the talk is as follows: First we will briefly recall the basic principles of Bayesian modeling. Then, we will treat a concrete and simple example, using a Jupyter notebook, where we show how to set up a Markov chain Monte Carlo simulation with PyMC3.

This talk is addressed for non-experts and no prior knowledge on Bayesian modeling is required.

Lightning Talks

Usually there will also be the opportunity to give lightning talks. Please consider giving one and register yours on this EtherPad!

Restaurant

At about 8:45 pm we’ll move to a nearby restaurant.

name: Outdoor Fitness (Cardio & Strength) - Beginner Level
description:
*** Eine Deutsche Version findest du unten*** 

Please book all sessions in advance on MEET2MOVE.DE (German & English available).

Our interval training is designed to improve strength, build lean muscles, improves cardiovascular fitness, increase speed and maximize calorie burn. This workout uses a variety of body weight exercises and provides the challenge and intensity you need to get results fast.

At Meet2Move we believe that fitness can be joyful. Soak up some sun while getting sweaty. Forty-five minutes is all it takes to transform the way you look and feel. We run, we jump, we do push-ups, we do burpees, we set our intention, and we break through boundaries. The best part: We do it together, as a community.

Backed by the science of Excess Post-Exercise Oxygen Consumption, Meet2Move's heart rate monitored workout is designed to maintain an optimal target zone that stimulates metabolism and increases energy. The so-called “afterburn effect” enables you to burn an estimated 400 to 750 calories in 45 minutes. And keep burning calories for up to 36 hours.

With powerful music, you’ll get the energy of a group workout with the attention of an inspirational personal coach. Our coaches are knowledgeable, encouraging and are committed to motivating you to go harder to get fit, fast.

In the training for Level 1-3, we focus on basic exercises, which can be performed by everyone. In comparison to Level 3-5, there will also be shorter interval cycles. Nevertheless, each exercise is explained in different intensities, so that you simply choose your intensity according to your fitness level. So do not be afraid and just try it out. If you are still unsure, just talk to me or write me an email to [masked].

You don’t have to bring anything except for your own drink and the heart rate sensor. If it is your first session with us, we will provide you with a sensor. To properly calibrate the system, please send your date of birth, height, and weight to [masked] before the session. I will bring all other equipment and of course some motivational music. Please remember that we train outside in the park and there are no changing rooms on the premises. Within a radius of 100 meters, there are several restaurants that have not been complaining so far, when one of us had to go to the toilet. Since we don’t leave the training place, we have so far not had any problems with theft of our own valuables. Only in extremely bad weather conditions will we cancel the workouts. If you would like to be informed in our WhatsApp group, just send me your number and I will add you. 

For any further questions, please just write me an email to [masked].

I look forward to seeing you, Tim


First Trial Week - FREE OF CHARGE

4 times a month - 12€ (3€/session)

8 times a month - 20€ (2,50€/session)

Unlimited - 30€ (2€/session)

__________________________________________ 

Bitte buche deine Termine immer vorab auf MEET2MOVE.DE.

Unser Intervalltraining ist darauf ausgelegt, deine Kraft zu verbessern, Muskeln aufzubauen, die kardiovaskuläre Fitness zu verbessern, die Schnelligkeit zu erhöhen und deine Kalorienverbrennung zu maximieren. Wir verwenden eine Vielzahl von Körpergewicht Übungen, die Sie benötigen, um schnelle Ergebnisse zu erzielen. 

Wir bei Meet2Move glauben fest daran, dass Fitness jede Menge Spaß macht. 45 Minuten ist alles was du brauchst um dich mit frischer Luft und tollen Trainingspartnern super zu fühlen. Ob Laufen, Liegestütz oder Burpees, wir setzen unser Vorhaben und brechen Grenzen. Der beste Teil: Wir machen es zusammen, als Community.

Wissenschaftlich auf dem Prinzip des Sauerstoffverbrauchs basierend, arbeiten wir bei jedem Training mit deiner Herzfrequenz. Du wirst dabei in deinem optimalen Herzfrequenzbereich trainieren, welcher deinen Stoffwechsel bestmöglich stimuliert und deine Energie erhöht. Der so genannte "Afterburn-Effekt" ermöglicht es dir, in 45 Minuten und den folgenden 36 Stunden bis zu 750 Kalorien zu verbrennen.

Mit motivierender Musik bekommst du die Energie eines Gruppen-Workouts mit der Aufmerksamkeit eines inspirierenden Personal Trainers. Unsere Trainer gehören zu den besten Deutschlands und ermutigen dich in jeder Übung an deine Grenzen zu gehen.

Im Training für Level 1-3 konzentrieren wir uns vor allem auf Grundübungen, die von jedem durchführbar sind. Im Vergleich zu Level 3-5 wird es auch kürzere Intervallzyklen geben. Dennoch wird jede Übung in unterschiedlichen Intensitätsstufen erklärt, so dass du dir einfach passend zu deinem Fitnessstand deine Intensität wählst. Daher habe keine Angst und probiere es einfach mal aus. Falls Du dennoch unsicher bist, frage mich einfach vor Ort oder schreib eine email an [masked].

Bis auf etwas zu trinken und unserem Pulssensor brauchst du nichts weiter mitzubringen. Wenn es deine erste Einheit ist werden wir dir einen Pulssensor vor Ort zur Verfügung stellen. Um das System richtig zu kalibrieren sende uns bitte vorab dein Geburtsdatum, Größe und Gewicht an [masked]. Ich bringe alle anderen Geräte und natürlich auch motivierende Musik mit. Bitte denkt daran, dass wir draußen im Park trainieren und es vor Ort keine Umkleideräume gibt. Im Umkreis von 100 Metern gibt es mehrere Restaurants, die sich bislang noch nicht beschwert haben, wenn mal einer von uns auf die Toilette musste. Da wir den Trainingsort nicht verlassen, haben wir bislang noch keine Probleme mit Diebstahl von eigenen Wertgegenständen gehabt. Nur bei extrem schlechten Wetterbedingungen werden wir die Workouts absagen. Falls du zusätzlich noch in unserer WhatsApp Gruppe informiert werden möchtest sende mir einfach deine Nummer und ich füge dich hinzu.

Falls du noch Fragen haben solltest, schreibe mir einfach eine Email an [masked]. Ich freue mich auf dich! Tim

Arno Döring,Founder, Co-Producer & Chief of Virtual Reality bei Origin Bridge


Topic: The Augmented Reality Studio, Usescases of it, Ready to rent!

Arno holds a Bachelor of Art in Media Management and TV Producing. During his studies he worked for the startup Mycluster.tv in the production and post-production of event videos. He then went on to work with Fox Mobile Distribution GmbH, where he designed audio-visual concepts in close cooperation with the marketing department. Arno also supported the B28 Produktion Gmbh & Co.KG with the production of ‘Berlinale’ for the TV channel ZDF.

In 2011, he founded his own media company, electric-eyes, which specializes in film production and commercials. He produces and edits numerous image films and presentation videos for corporate clients like General Electric, NH Hotel Group, N24 and many more. He is also a software specialist in After Effects, Premiere Pro, Photoshop, Indesign, Illustrator and Cinema 4D.

Arno also recently co-founded the company DADB Deutsche Akademie für Digitale Bildung GmbH where he holds the positions of co-founder, VR- and Art Director.

Vishwajit Kashid, Freelance Mind Re-Engineering Expert,Brand Ambassador of Platelets-Plasma Donations,Regional Head at Happy-Roommate.in

Topic: "Mindset Re-Engineering" to outperform individual’s capabilities in all aspects of Life.
I am Vishwajit Kashid from India by education I am Computer Engineer.Born with Neurological Disorder called Dysarthria (Dysarthria is a motor speech disorder).Not having natural ability to speak properly got me in to terrible state of isolation from having normal or average childhood which we consider important from the aspects of first formative years of life where we understands human emotions,Friendships,Social Connections.At the age of 12, Fed up of all the rejects,Insults,failures & isolation I decided to deal with the situation,this leads me to exploration of ancient Indian scientific references on human Mind.With the help of combination of some of ancient Indian teachings & some of my own developed strategies I have out performed in all the horizon's of my own life.          


Once considered as kind of speech disabled person today conducting successful training programs  for "Out-performance of an Individual through Mindset Re-Engineering" across various fields such as Corporate,Educational Institutions,for Artists & International Sports Athletes.On social welfare side,till present I have delivered strategic talks on hundreds of platforms across various parts of INDIA,Sri Lanka,Thailand & Dubai covering near about 2,00,000 audiences especially youth in less privileged & less developed parts of the world.Today,mission of my life is to go out in the world everyday,and spread this knowledge to help humanity across the planet so that they can live life full of prosperity.

name: Vom „Geheimbund der transparenten Gehälter“ zu einem neuen Gehaltsworkflow
description:
DAS PROGRAMM

Wir haben einen spannenden Talk von Jens Broos für Euch vorbereitet, Details dazu im Folgenden. Gegen 19:00 Uhr geht es los, für Getränke und Pizza ist gesorgt und Fragen und Ideenaustausch sind willkommen.

Wir freuen uns auf Euch. :-)

DER TALK

Wie wir über den „Geheimbund der transparenten Gehälter“ zu einem neuen Gehaltsworkflow kamen.

In 2015 reifte die Idee von „transparenten Gehältern“ bereits in den Köpfen einiger Kollegen. Doch es gab Widerstände unter dem Rest der Crew. Also bedienten wir uns eines „Kultur-Hacks“: In einer Bierlaune gründeten wir den „Geheimbund der transparenten Gehälter“. Alle Mitglieder, die durch Unterschrift auf die „Magna Carta“ aufgenommen wurden, verpflichten sich, innerhalb des Geheimbundes ihre Gehälter offen zu legen, nach außen jedoch absolutes Stillschweigen zu bewahren.

Das schlug große Wellen!

In einer Firmenretrospektive, die mit sehr viel Emotion geführt wurde, setzten wir uns zusammen und tauschten uns aus. Aber dabei fiel uns etwas ganz Anderes auf: Natürlich gab es viele negative Gefühle zum Geheimbund, aber noch viel mehr Unzufriedenheit gab es über unseren Gehaltsworkflow. Diesen haben wir dann komplett umgekrempelt und rundum erneuert.

Ein Jahr ist das nun her, die erste Runde ist geschafft und wir arbeiten gerade an der Integration des Feedbacks in die zweite Iteration. In meinem Talk möchte ich euch unseren Gehaltsworkflow vorstellen und von seiner Entstehungsgeschichte als wesentliches Element unserer agilen Transition erzählen.

DER SPEAKER

Jens Broos betreut seit 2011 Kundenprojekte für die Mayflower GmbH. Durch sein Studium der Medieninformatik und als „echter“ Pfadfinder kennt er sowohl die technischen Anforderungen an große Softwareprojekte, als auch die zwischenmenschlichen und organisatorischen Bedürfnisse agiler Teams. Als Agile Coach berät er Entwickler und Kunden vor Ort oder auch in weltweit verteilten Teams bei der Umsetzung und Integration agiler Methoden und Prozesse. Die gemeinschaftliche Bearbeitung von Themen sind seine Passion.

name: 3 days of canyoning, mountain hiking and via-ferrata-climbing in Trentino, Italy
description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rRfC7vPdckY

+++ ONLY 3 SPOTS AVAILABLE ON MEETUP.COM!!! +++


Are you up for an intense and adventurous trip packed with breathtaking outdoor activities in spectacular natural surroundings? During this trip, we will climb into dizzying heights in the rocky landscape of the Dolomiti di Brenta and Lago di Garda mountains, abseil down into deep ravines, jump into crystal clear water pools from up to 12 meters and enjoy one of the best sceneries the Alps have to offer. Catering and accommodation (tent on a campsite) will be quite cheap and basic. However, the guided canyoning sports itself is one of the most expensive parts of the trip (88 EUR per person).


What it costs


The costs for this trip are 280,00 EUR (255 EUR if you bring your own via-ferrata-set) and include:


bus transfer from Berlin to Bolzano (Italy) and back

car rental and fuel for 3 days and 280 km

via ferrata equipment rental

3 x breakfast and 3 x packed lunch

camp site fee for 2 days

guided canyoning trip (88 EUR)

non-driver surcharge (our 4 rental car drivers get a discount of 40 EUR on the trip being paid by their fellow passengers)


What we are going to do

On the first day of our trip, we are going to tackle a spectacular albeit beginner-friendly via-ferrata, the via ferrata Fausto Susatti at the northern lakeside of Lake Garda. This day tour will take us about 5-6 hours to complete and offers stunning views over Lake Garda. Provided that weather conditions are well suited for that kind of endeavour we will go for a high-alpine tour in Dolomiti di Brenta on Sunday. That day tour is going to be quite strenuous but all the more rewarding.  On the 3rd day, we embark on a spectacular canyoning tour in the Torrente Vione. We will be moving along the canyon by swimming, abseiling and jumping into water pools under the guidance of a professional tour operator.


What is a via ferrata?

a via ferrata is basically a protected climbing route with a steel cable running along the route and being periodically fixed to the rocks. Climbers secure themselves by attaching their via-ferrata kit to this cable. Besides, the climbing route of a via ferrata provides artificial aids like ladders, iron rungs and carved steps which makes it accessible for non-climbers.


What is canyoning?

Canyoning is a sports activity which is about moving down a canyon by hiking, scrambling, swimming, rappelling and cliff jumping. Usually, you do it in a swimsuit with a helmet on. In order to do canyoning you should have a decent general fitness and you should be able to swim.


How to pay


Please make a down payment via paypal (send money to family and friends option) at a height of 35 EUR by 30 July and bring the remainder cash to the trip!


Itinerary


Friday, 11 August: departure in Berlin

We meet in front of the green Flixbus office at Berlin ZOB with direction to Bolzano (Italy) at 20:30 and sleep in the bus overnight.

Saturday, 12 August: arrival in Bozen - via ferrata Fausto Susatti

We arrive by bus in the picturesque town of Bozen (Bolzano) at 9:00. We start with a hearty traditional breakfast in Bozen downtown, shop some groceries for our packed lunches and then pick up our rental cars and head towards Arco at the northern lakeside of Lago di Garda where we start our via ferrata tour “Fausto Susatti”. This route is rather easy in technical terms but it offers stunning views over the Lake Garda and it will take us about 5 hours to finish the tour. Along the route we encounter several fortifications built during World War I. Afterwards, we have a 1.5 hours car ride north to the village of Campiglio di Madonna at the foothills of the Brenta mountains where we whip our tents at a campsite and stay overnight.

Sunday, 13 August: Sentiero Bocchette Centrali, Dolomiti di Brenta 

This tour is a real highlight of our trip. However, it can only be done under proper weather conditions. If that’s not the case, we go for an alternative option (i.e. via Ferrata Gerardo Sega). We start out towards 8am and embark on a 8-9 hours mountain tour in the Brenta Dolomites. The starting point of our hike is Rifugio Valessinale a parking lot about 11km away from our campsite, about 1500 meters above sea level. We hike up to the entrance point of the via ferrata in 2-3 hours overcoming 1100 meters of altitude. From this point onwards, we do a 2-3 hours loop walk in high-alpine terrain before descending the same way to the parking lot.  Although the tour is rather moderately difficult in technical terms it requires you to have a fairly good stamina (!!!). However, the via ferrata bocchette centrali is deemed one of the most spectacular walks in the entire Alps. Upon arrival at the parking lot, we head towards our 2nd campsite near Lago di Ledro.  

Monday, 14 August: canyoning Torrente Vione - return ride to Berlin


This day we are going to embark on an awesome canyoning tour west of Lake Garda. Highlights include a 45 meters abseiling section and jumps into water pools from up to 10 meters. We will spend around 5 hours in the water under the guidance of a certified canyoning guide. Upon completion of this canyoning trip we get into rental cars, head towards Bozen, return the cars and take the bus back to Berlin.


Tuesday, 15 August: arrival in Berlin at 8:30am

name: Random Hacks of Kindness-Social Digital Innovation Berlin 2017

venue.name: ReDi School of Digital Integration Headquarter

description:
Join brilliant social entrepreneurs from Social Digital Innovation and ReDI-School and the teams from Social Digital Innovation and Random Hacks of Kindness for a hackathon weekend working on a series of fantastic projects!


You can read about all the projects on our Hackdash.

What we need from you are your skills and your passion. We’re looking for people who can help our teams develop technical solutions to their problems. If you’re a techie looking for a challenge that will make a real difference to people around Berlin and around the world, come and join. If you have a background in design, business or innovation and want to work with dedicated teams with big ideas, come and join.

In addition to the hackathon itself, we’ll have expert mentors coming in to provide guidance and feedback and help your ideas succeed. The organizations will give follow up support after the weekend to help make sure these projects thrive long term, and connecting participants with global networks and resources to support your work going forward. 

Random Hacks of Kindness is committed to creating a world where social solutions use technologies meaningfully, are impact driven, sustainable and benefit and belong to those who create them.

Social Digital Innovation is committed to creating a world where social solutions use technologies meaningfully, are impact driven, sustainable and benefit and belong to those who create them.


The ReDI-School of Design Integration provides students with valuable digital skills and a strong network of tech leaders, students and alumni to help create new opportunities for all.

We'll be hacking all weekend, and we'd love to see you there!

name: Outdoor Fitness (Cardio & Strength) - Advanced Level
description:
*** Eine Deutsche Version findest du unten*** 

Please book all sessions in advance on MEET2MOVE.DE (German & English available).

Our interval training is designed to improve strength, build lean muscles, improves cardiovascular fitness, increase speed and maximize calorie burn. This workout uses a variety of body weight exercises and provides the challenge and intensity you need to get results fast.

At Meet2Move we believe that fitness can be joyful. Soak up some sun while getting sweaty. Forty-five minutes is all it takes to transform the way you look and feel. We run, we jump, we do push-ups, we do burpees, we set our intention, and we break through boundaries. The best part: We do it together, as a community.

Backed by the science of Excess Post-Exercise Oxygen Consumption, Meet2Move's heart rate monitored workout is designed to maintain an optimal target zone that stimulates metabolism and increases energy. The so-called “afterburn effect” enables you to burn an estimated 400 to 750 calories in 45 minutes. And keep burning calories for up to 36 hours.

With powerful music, you’ll get the energy of a group workout with the attention of an inspirational personal coach. Our coaches are knowledgeable, encouraging and are committed to motivating you to go harder to get fit, fast.

In the training for Level 3-5, we will focus on more complex and challenging exercises. Also, the interval cycles will be longer or the pause times will be shorter. Nevertheless, each exercise is explained in different intensities, so that you simply choose your intensity according to your fitness level. Even if you have, for example, knee pain, but otherwise belong to the fitter athletes, we always find a solution. Just talk to me before the training or write me an email to [masked].

You don’t have to bring anything except for your own drink and the heart rate sensor. If it is your first session with us, we will provide you with a sensor. To properly calibrate the system, please send your date of birth, height, and weight to [masked] before the session. I will bring all other equipment and of course some motivational music. Please remember that we train outside in the park and there are no changing rooms on the premises. Within a radius of 100 meters, there are several restaurants that have not been complaining so far, when one of us had to go to the toilet. Since we don’t leave the training place, we have so far not had any problems with theft of our own valuables. 

Only in extremely bad weather conditions will we cancel the workouts. If you would like to be informed in our WhatsApp group, just send me your number and I will add you. For any further questions, please just write me an email to [masked].

I look forward to seeing you, Tim


First Trial Week - FREE OF CHARGE

4 times a month - 12€ (3€/session)

8 times a month - 20€ (2,50€/session)

Unlimited - 30€ (2€/session)

__________________________________________ 

Bitte buche deine Termine immer vorab auf MEET2MOVE.DE.

Unser Intervalltraining ist darauf ausgelegt, deine Kraft zu verbessern, Muskeln aufzubauen, die kardiovaskuläre Fitness zu verbessern, die Schnelligkeit zu erhöhen und deine Kalorienverbrennung zu maximieren. Wir verwenden eine Vielzahl von Körpergewicht Übungen, die Sie benötigen, um schnelle Ergebnisse zu erzielen. 

Wir bei Meet2Move glauben fest daran, dass Fitness jede Menge Spaß macht. 45 Minuten ist alles was du brauchst um dich mit frischer Luft und tollen Trainingspartnern super zu fühlen. Ob Laufen, Liegestütz oder Burpees, wir setzen unser Vorhaben und brechen Grenzen. Der beste Teil: Wir machen es zusammen, als Community.

Wissenschaftlich auf dem Prinzip des Sauerstoffverbrauchs basierend, arbeiten wir bei jedem Training mit deiner Herzfrequenz. Du wirst dabei in deinem optimalen Herzfrequenzbereich trainieren, welcher deinen Stoffwechsel bestmöglich stimuliert und deine Energie erhöht. Der so genannte "Afterburn-Effekt" ermöglicht es dir, in 45 Minuten und den folgenden 36 Stunden bis zu 750 Kalorien zu verbrennen.

Mit motivierender Musik bekommst du die Energie eines Gruppen-Workouts mit der Aufmerksamkeit eines inspirierenden Personal Trainers. Unsere Trainer gehören zu den besten Deutschlands und ermutigen dich in jeder Übung an deine Grenzen zu gehen.

Im Training für Level 3-5 konzentrieren wir uns im Vergleich zu Level 1-3 auf komplexere und anspruchsvollere Übungen, die dich mehr fordern werden. Ebenfalls werden die Intervallzyklen länger sein oder die Pausenzeiten kürzer. Dennoch wird jede Übung in unterschiedlichen Intensitätsstufen erklärt, so dass du dir einfach passend zu deinem Fitnessstand deine Intensität wählst. Auch wenn du beispielsweise Knieschmerzen hast, sonst aber eher zu den Fitteren gehörst, finden wir dafür immer eine Lösung. Wichtig ist, dass du mich dazu einfach vor dem Training darauf ansprichst. Falls Du dennoch unsicher bist, schreib mir einfach ein email an [masked].

Bis auf etwas zu trinken und unserem Pulssensor brauchst du nichts weiter mitzubringen. Wenn es deine erste Einheit ist werden wir dir einen Pulssensor vor Ort zur Verfügung stellen. Um das System richtig zu kalibrieren sende uns bitte vorab dein Geburtsdatum, Größe und Gewicht an [masked]. Ich bringe alle anderen Geräte und natürlich auch motivierende Musik mit. Bitte denkt daran, dass wir draußen im Park trainieren und es vor Ort keine Umkleideräume gibt. Im Umkreis von 100 Metern gibt es mehrere Restaurants, die sich bislang noch nicht beschwert haben, wenn mal einer von uns auf die Toilette musste. Da wir den Trainingsort nicht verlassen, haben wir bislang noch keine Probleme mit Diebstahl von eigenen Wertgegenständen gehabt. 

Nur bei extrem schlechten Wetterbedingungen werden wir die Workouts absagen. Falls du zusätzlich noch in unserer WhatsApp Gruppe informiert werden möchtest sende mir einfach deine Nummer und ich füge dich hinzu. Falls du noch Fragen haben solltest, schreibe mir einfach eine Email an [masked]. 

Ich freue mich auf dich! Tim

name: Canoe (Kanu) from Treptower park on the Spree and Kanal- Insel der Jugend
Science Hack Lab
description:
Tell us in the comments below what you plan to work on and what skills/equipment you need – we'll mail the community shortly before the HackLab to help you reach out for collaborators!

********************************************************************

The monthly Science Hack Lab takes place on the 2nd Saturday of each month. Bring your pet projects, favourite electronics, junk lab equipment, microbial friends, specialist knowledge and imagination. Let’s Hack!

Who is this Hack Lab for?
This is for all of you out there who want to actually get down to it and do/make/build stuff in an awesomely collaborative and multidisciplinary way, whether or not you have a concrete project in mind. Everyone brings their own skills to the table - be it in coding, designing, tinkering, electronics, thinking up hackable situations/problems, microscopy, knitting, origami, particle physics, building models out of pipe-cleaners/string/glue/paper, free-diving, environmental monitoring, gardening, click chemistry, cell biology, data visualisation, engineering… it’s a pretty long list. It doesn’t matter if you’ve never done this before - just come along and get stuck in.

What will happen?
We start 1pm. Once enough people have arrived (probably around 1:15-1:30) we’ll do a round of introductions – tell us what you have in your mind, explain what your project is, ask for input/help, or offer your skills – to get inspired and get an overview of what people are working on. Then we’re gonna hack until the end of the day. We'll do a wrap-up at 6pm with short presentations of the hack of the day.

What should I bring?
Bring your favourite tools and basic materials you think you might need for prototyping. We have a box of left-over bits and pieces from the last Science Hack Day that you can rummage around in (details to follow in the comments section). We won’t be organising any official catering, so bring snacks and drinks. TIP: make friends by bringing something to share, especially cake ;)

Wanna have a workshop?
Would you like us to have a workshop on a particular topic (like sensors, microscopes, making art inspired by science, etc), or to volunteer to run on one? Put your ideas in the Meetup discussion forum!

name: Lets practice German and meet new people!

group.name: Spre-chill: Speak German while chilling in Berlin

description:
Location to be defined depending on the weather.

Hallo Leute! 


We all know that German is a very difficult language. But what would happen if we all worked together and helped each other to improve it? This is the perfect event for those who are eager to improve their German level and meet new people in Berlin. What's more, it's already Summer, so why not go outside and have a drink with people who might think like you.


The methodology is simple. The idea is to create a group of people with common interests and gather every Sunday in a different place in the city. It could be a park, lake, bar or anywhere else where we can have fun. There will probably be some learning games so we can improve our levels. So, be ready to participate, give feedback or contribute with your own ideas. You don't need to have any specific level, just come along willing to speak German. Kein Englisch bitte.

Price: Kostenlos! However, if the event is held in a park bring at least something to share in the picnic. If it is it a bar, buy at least one drink.

You can also bring any type of material that has helped you to improve your German; books, texts, copies, games, apps etc. By doing so we can all share our ideas to help with our studies.

So, pack your bag with energy to learn German and we'll see each other on Saturday!

We will be there. Look for the German flag


In case the weather does not help we will change the location.

Follow our Facebook group for more 

information:https://www.facebook.com/sprechill/
